quests.desc: You are now playing a life changing session of TextWorld! Here is how to play! First stop, move west. With that done, unlock the locker. After that, ensure that the locker inside the workshop is open. Then, pick up the latchkey from the locker within the workshop. If you can get your hands on the latchkey, make an effort to move east. If you can do that, unlock the gate. Then, open the gate. After pulling open the gate, go south. Once you succeed at that, take the keycard from the plate. And then, lock the box within the dish-pit with the keycard. Got that? Good!

infos.name: dish-pit
infos.desc:
You've just walked into a dish-pit. You begin to take stock of what's here.

 You see [if c_0 is locked]a locked[else if c_0 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] box in the room.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The box contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] The box is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] You can make out a plate. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a plate? [if there is something on the s_0]On the plate you can make out [a list of things on the s_0]. There's something strange about this being here, but you can't put your finger on it.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]The plate appears to be empty.[end if]

 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading north. There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading west.

infos.name: studio
infos.desc:
Well, here we are in the studio. The room seems oddly familiar, as though it were only superficially different from the other rooms in the building.

 You make out [if c_2 is locked]a locked[else if c_2 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] Canadian style box right there by you.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The Canadian style box contains [a list of things in the c_2].[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The Canadian style box is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You see a safe. Now that's what I call TextWorld![if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The safe contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading east. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going west.

infos.name: cookery
infos.desc:
You've just sauntered into a cookery. You start to take note of what's in the room.



You need an unblocked exit? You should try going east. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: shower
infos.desc:
You've just shown up in a shower.

 You can see a board! [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the board.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if] You make out a bench. [if there is something on the s_2]On the bench you can make out [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2]But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if] You see a table. [if there is something on the s_3]On the table you can see [a list of things on the s_3].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3]But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of junk.[end if]

 There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] portal leading west. There is an unblocked exit to the south.

infos.name: steam room
infos.desc:
You arrive in a steam room. A normal one.



 There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] portal leading east. There is [if d_5 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] stone portal leading south. There is [if d_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading west.

infos.name: study
infos.desc:
You've just shown up in a study.

 You can see a non-euclidean box.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The non-euclidean box contains [a list of things in the c_4].[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] The non-euclidean box is empty! What a waste of a day![end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going south. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: basement
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a basement. A normal kind of place.

 You can make out [if c_5 is locked]a locked[else if c_5 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] trunk in the room.[if c_5 is open and there is something in the c_5] The trunk contains [a list of things in the c_5].[end if][if c_5 is open and the c_5 contains nothing] What a letdown! The trunk is empty![end if]

 There is [if d_8 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading north. You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unguarded. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: cellar
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a cellar. A standard kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.



You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

infos.name: scullery
infos.desc:
You've entered a scullery. The room is well lit.



You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unblocked. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: bedchamber
infos.desc:
Well, here we are in a bedchamber. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You see [if c_6 is locked]a locked[else if c_6 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] type 3 safe nearby.[if c_6 is open and there is something in the c_6] The type 3 safe contains [a list of things in the c_6].[end if][if c_6 is open and the c_6 contains nothing] What a letdown! The type 3 safe is empty![end if] You make out a suitcase. You idly wonder how they came up with the name TextWorld for this place. It's pretty fitting.[if c_7 is open and there is something in the c_7] The suitcase contains [a list of things in the c_7].[end if][if c_7 is open and the c_7 contains nothing] The suitcase is empty! What a waste of a day![end if]

 There is [if d_7 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] hatch leading west. There is [if d_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading east.

infos.name: cubicle
infos.desc:
Well, here we are in a cubicle. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You make out a toolbox.[if c_8 is open and there is something in the c_8] The toolbox contains [a list of things in the c_8]. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on.[end if][if c_8 is open and the c_8 contains nothing] What a letdown! The toolbox is empty![end if]

 There is [if d_7 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] hatch leading east. There is [if d_6 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] walnut door leading south.

infos.name: washroom
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a washroom. An ordinary one.



 There is [if d_6 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] walnut door leading north. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: restroom
infos.desc:
You are in a restroom. An ordinary kind of place.



You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: bar
infos.desc:
You've just shown up in a bar.



You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: launderette
infos.desc:
You are in a launderette. A normal kind of place. You start to take note of what's in the room.

 If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's a spherical locker, so there's that.[if c_9 is open and there is something in the c_9] The spherical locker contains [a list of things in the c_9].[end if][if c_9 is open and the c_9 contains nothing] The spherical locker is empty, what a horrible day![end if] You see a counter. [if there is something on the s_4]On the counter you make out [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]However, the counter, like an empty counter, has nothing on it.[end if] Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a shelf. [if there is something on the s_5]You see [a list of things on the s_5] on the shelf.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5]But there isn't a thing on it. Hopefully, this discovery doesn't ruin your TextWorld experience![end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going east. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: garage
infos.desc:
You are in a garage. An ordinary kind of place.

 You see [if c_10 is locked]a locked[else if c_10 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] cabinet.[if c_10 is open and there is something in the c_10] The cabinet contains [a list of things in the c_10]. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things.[end if][if c_10 is open and the c_10 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] Look over there! a rack. [if there is something on the s_6]You see [a list of things on the s_6] on the rack. Hmmm... what else, what else?[end if][if there is nothing on the s_6]But the thing is empty.[end if]

 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] mahogany door leading north. There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading south. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: workshop
infos.desc:
You are in a workshop. An usual kind of place.

 You can make out a locker, so there's that.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The locker contains [a list of things in the c_1].[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] The locker is empty, what a horrible day![end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east.

infos.name: vault
infos.desc:
You are in a vault. A standard one. The room is well lit.

 You see a gleam over in a corner, where you can see a workbench. [if there is something on the s_7]On the workbench you see [a list of things on the s_7]. It doesn't get more TextWorld than this![end if][if there is nothing on the s_7]But the thing is empty, unfortunately. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if]

 There is [if d_5 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] stone portal leading north. There is [if d_8 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading south. There is [if d_9 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] oak gateway leading west.

infos.name: pantry
infos.desc:
You've entered a pantry.

 You can see [if c_11 is locked]a locked[else if c_11 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] chest in the room.[if c_11 is open and there is something in the c_11] The chest contains [a list of things in the c_11]. Classic TextWorld.[end if][if c_11 is open and the c_11 contains nothing] What a letdown! The chest is empty![end if] Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a stand. The stand is typical.[if there is something on the s_8] On the stand you can make out [a list of things on the s_8].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_8] However, the stand, like an empty stand, has nothing on it.[end if]

 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] mahogany door leading south. There is [if d_9 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] oak gateway leading east.

infos.desc:
You are in an office. A standard one.



You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north.

objective: Hey, thanks for coming over to the TextWorld today, there is something I need you to do for me. First, it would be a great idea if you could make an attempt to go west. Then, doublecheck that the locker is unlocked with the key. After you have unlocked the locker, ensure that the locker within the workshop is open. After that, take the latchkey from the locker in the workshop. With the latchkey, move east. If you can manage that, check that the gate is unlocked with the latchkey. After that, make absolutely sure that the gate within the garage is wide open. After that, try to go to the south. Then, take the keycard from the plate in the dish-pit. After getting the keycard, look and see that the box is locked. Once that's all handled, you can stop!
